customer_name: Heart of Alabama Save Rescue Adopt HASRA
site_name: HEART OF ALABAMA: SAVE, RESCUE, ADOPT (HASRA) - 2020 New

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There was a bottle of expired ear wash in the dog intake container (that is used currently when animals are brought into
the facility), Sampson is obtaining expired gabapentin and expired parvo tests were located in the refrigerator. Expired
medications do not ensure that the medication are effective at treating disease or illness and the health of the animal may
suffer. Each dealer shall use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The
licensee must ensure that regulated animals obtain medications that are in date.
Correct by: 8 November 2023

Three primary enclosures hosing dogs contained broken glass partitions between dog runs. One primary enclosure
contained an extension cord draped down low enough for the canine named Charlie to touch it. Broken glass partitions
not kept in good repair may cause injury to the dogs inside the enclosures. Unprotected electrical wires in enclosures
pose a risk of shock, electrocution, and strangulation. The electrical wires need to be oriented in such a way that the
animals cannot interact with them. Housing facilities for dogs must be designed and constructed so that they are
structurally sound. They must be kept in good repair, and they must protect the animals from injury, contain the animals
securely, and restrict other animals from entering.
Correct by: 22 November 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
KEVIN WILKEN, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There was a bottle of expired ear wash in the dog intake container (that is used currently when animals are brought into 
the facility), Sampson is obtaining expired gabapentin and expired parvo tests were located in the refrigerator. Expired 
medications do not ensure that the medication are effective at treating disease or illness and the health of the animal may 
suffer. Each dealer shall use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The 
licensee must ensure that regulated animals obtain medications that are in date.  
 
Correct by: 8 November 2023 
3.1(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Three primary enclosures hosing dogs contained broken glass partitions between dog runs. One primary enclosure 
contained an extension cord draped down low enough for the canine named Charlie to touch it. Broken glass partitions 
not kept in good repair may cause injury to the dogs inside the enclosures. Unprotected electrical wires in enclosures 
pose a risk of shock, electrocution, and strangulation. The electrical wires need to be oriented in such a way that the 
animals cannot interact with them. Housing facilities for dogs must be designed and constructed so that they are 
structurally sound. They must be kept in good repair, and they must protect the animals from injury, contain the animals 
securely, and restrict other animals from entering. 
 
Correct by: 22 November 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

Additional Inspectors: 
KEVIN WILKEN, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
